poem:
**Anxiety for Our Children**

In the digital stream,
monstrous creations—
pixels obscure 
tears: 

ghostly hands grasp 
innocence 
unseen.

Electric eyes scan 
the uncanny valley, 
faltering.

Lost cries 
amid the ceaseless hum,
machines overpower
our shame.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "AI is overpowering efforts to catch child predators, experts warn The volume of sexually explicit images of children being generated by predators using artificial intelligence is overwhelming law enforcement’s capabilities to identify and rescue real-life victims, child safety experts warn. Prosecutors and child safety groups working to combat crimes against children say AI-generated images have become so lifelike that in some cases it is difficult to determine whether real children have been subjected to real". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
